page.title: 06Col.Tingey-Local Government
page.content: Colonel Tingey kindly explained to us how local{government}works.The County Council is based at{Taunton.}It has to take care of the Libraries, Museums, Fire Services, Education, Police and Schools.The District{Council}of which Col. Tingey is a member, looks after Housing, Planning, Leisure and Recreation and Enviromental Health.Parish Councils just raise money for local causes. Colonel Tingey has been on the Parish Council for 15 years and on the District Council for 12 years. He belongs to the East Polden District Council which takes care of Shapwick, Ashcott, Moorlynch and Greinton. Now that Col. Tingey is retired, a lot of his time is spent as a councillor. He prefers to work with{people}though, rather than attending council meetings.
